title: Unit 0: Foundations
text:
Learning Objectives

Learn importance of reproducible research
Learn key principles of reproducible research
Learn how to design and implement a reproducible research workflow

Version control using git and github
Literate programming using Quarto
Package managemenet using renv

title: Unit 0: Foundations
text:
Preparation

1. Read/Watch/Listen:

Happy with Git and GitHub for the UseR



2. Computing Setup:
To ensure a smooth experience during class, please follow these steps:

Install R (v4.x or later)

CRAN Download or via your preferred package manager.

Install RStudio or a similar IDE

RStudio Download

Install Quarto

Quarto Installation – ensures you can render .qmd files.

Install Git

Confirm Git is accessible from the command line:
git --version
Windows: Git for Windows

macOS: Use Xcode Command Line Tools or Homebrew.

Create a GitHub Account

GitHub Signup – used for version control and code sharing.

Set Up Credentials (SSH keys or PAT)

Helps push/pull to GitHub without repeated logins.

GitHub Docs: Connecting to GitHub with SSH

Install Required R Packages

In R/RStudio, run:
install.packages(c("tidyverse",
                   "renv",
                   "devtools",
                   "broom",
                   "infer",
                   "rmarkdown",
                   "quarto"))

Optional but Recommended: Set Up Renv

We will use renv to manage R package versions.

Renv Documentation


Once you have completed the above steps, you should be ready for our in-class activities.
